page.title: 07Moving to Ythanwells
page.content: We moved to Ythanwells in January 1985 when my husband's change of job made us leave Yorkshire. His work is based in Dyce,so he has a 40 minute journey by car each morning and evening.As property prices and rates are extreme- ly high in Aberdeen, we had to look further afield where prices are lower, hence our arrival at Ythanwells Cot- age.It is small, but has potentials for an extension.We have a pumped water supply from a well and drain- age via a septic tank.I found this strange at first,having always lived in a town!The neighbours have made us very welcome and the countryside is beautiful. Our only reservations about moving here are the bad snow in winter which cuts us off, and occasional feelings of isolation as it is so quiet. However, our views may change as we get accustomed to country life.
